Congressman DeSantis voted on nonbinding: 2. The budget resolutions proposed transitioning Medicare to a premium support system by 2019 for new beneficiaries, raising the Medicare retirement age to 70, and indexing it to life expectancy.
The resolutions also suggested switching: known as chained CPI, and increasing the full retirement age to 70, also indexed to life expectancy.
However: it is debatable whether these budget resolutions would have actually led to cuts in Social Security and Medicare benefits, as they were nonbinding and would have depended on separate legislation becoming law.
